thread.title: Michael Appleton passes his Oxford exam as he eyes FA Cup KO of Middlesbrough after already dumping out Newcastle
thread.title_full: Michael Appleton passes his Oxford exam as he eyes FA Cup KO of Middlesbrough after already dumping out Newcastle

author: ituckey
title: Michael Appleton passes his Oxford exam as he eyes FA Cup KO of Middlesbrough after already dumping out Newcastle
text:
Comments MICHAEL APPLETON knows his Oxford education is setting him up for life. 
Appleton takes the U’s to Middlesbrough today hoping to inflict another North-East upset after knocking out Newcastle in the last round. 4 Oxford boss Michael Appleton believe she has learn from his tough background 
His stock with the fans is at an all-time high following promotion to League One last season and an impressive campaign this term. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FA Cup news 
But after making self-confessed errors in taking jobs at crisis clubs Blackpool, Blackburn and Portsmouth, Appleton insists it would take something extra special to ditch the good thing he has going at the Kassam Stadium. 
The ex- West Brom coach, 41, said: “I’ve definitely learnt that the grass isn’t always greener. 
“I’ve probably found that out the hard way but that can often be the best thing to happen to you. 
“There have been many opportunities over the last 2½ years to leave and I have an open relationship with my chairman Daryl Eales. 
“It would take a very good side and a very good offer to tempt me away from Oxford, as long as we continue to be competitive and I continue to get the opportunity to make us competitive.” 
Appleton has had to rebuild his reputation at Oxford following short spells at Blackpool and Blackburn. PA:Press Association 4 Appleton hopes to complete a north-east double in the FA Cup by beating Boro 
Having left administration-hit Pompey for Blackpool in November 2012, he quit the Seasiders after just 65 days for Rovers. 
But it was a case of out of the frying pan and into the fire, and he lasted only 67 days. 
It was to be another 16 months before he would get back into the game in July 2014 with Oxford, where he has been ever since. 
Appleton, who began at Manchester United as a teenager, added: “A lot of people have made judgments on myself around the Blackpool and Blackburn situation which was a poor decision on my behalf. Getty Images 4 Boro manager Aitor Karanka is keen to avoid a shock and reach the quarter-finals 
“What I would have done differently, and will do differently if I get jobs in management, is do my due diligence a bit better. 
“As a young coach leaving West Brom you think you can take on the world and the reality is a lot of things have to fall in place for you to be successful. 
“But whoever the top six managers in the world are, I’d be amazed if they would have done anything different at Blackpool, Blackburn or even Pompey. 
“I think the timing was crucial of going to those clubs, where there were a lot of issues which were very, very difficult to control.” RELATED STORIES Sleepy Lee...but will the defender's error cost his side? ROAR EMOTION Sutton striker Roarie Deacon has a photo of him signing for Arsenal pride of place in his home... now he is back in the frame for Arsene Wenger BALLS-UP FA hit Leyton Orient's Liam Kelly with six-match ban for pushing over Plymouth ballboy Beer we go All hands to the pump as Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses for visit of Arsenal Jose's Cup of tea Jose Mourinho claims foreign bosses don't respect the FA Cup... but he will never field a weakened side 24/ 7 heaven Bruno claims to have discovered the fountain of youth — at Brighton's state-of-the-art HQ WINNERS NOT WHINERS Antonio Conte is prioritising trophies over egos so he can meet Roman Abramovich's demands NEIL ASHTON Arsene Wenger had a Gun to his head after embarrassing Bayern thrashing... but it was the Arsenal boss who came out firing Karren Brady Slaven Bilic's touchline temper tantrum was bad... but refs are getting more decisions wrong this season IAN WRIGHT Arsenal have no excuses... Sutton's plastic pitch should suit Arsene Wenger's side down to the ground 'Wasted on me' Burton's Jackson Irvine snubbed £100k-a-week pay-rise in China... to stay with Championship strugglers Reffin' hell Premier League faces referee crisis with Michael Oliver targeted by MLS... just 48 hours after Mark Clattenburg quit 
Appleton — the only Fergie fledgling to be managing in England, apart from Sir Alex’s son Darren Ferguson at Doncaster —­ had to suffer a hit to his pride after leaving Blackburn. 
And he admits there is a part of him that feels vindicated for the jobs he did given how poorly they have all fared since he left. 
He said: “I mean this in the nicest possible way but from a real selfish point of view, there’s a little bit of comfort there. 
“Because when I was at those clubs I thought I was doing a pretty good job to stabilise them.” 
All Appleton is focused on now is making his young Oxford side as good as they can be — and a shock win at the Riverside would go along way to taking them to the next level. Reuters 4 Darren Ferguson is the only other protege of his dad Alex managing in England 
He added: “Over a period of time we’ve been able to change how people think and act. Now we have a progressive group that are young and enthusiastic. 
“We’re under no illusions how difficult the tie will be at Boro because they will see it as a great opportunity to make the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. 
“One or two of their players will have to have off days, seven or eight of our players will have to be right at top of their game and our goalkeeper will have to another good game like he did against Newcastle. 
“But if those ingredients happen, backed by 3,500 Oxford fans, we’ll have a chance.” Oxford 3-0 Newcastle : Oxford through to fifth round for first time in 23 years Middlesbrough 0-0 Everton : Keepers come out on top
